comment: It's the beginning of Fall & this rating will probably change at the end of the semester. I have to say her lectures are infuriating to listen to so far. The amount of mispronunciation of words, using the completely wrong words, words slurring together, and constant use of "umm" going on in such a short lecture is like nails on a chalkboard for me.
if anyone had her for psyc 3205 can someone like this if her exams were lockdown with webcam pleaseeee

There was a lot of reading and weekly discussion posts, but they were not awful. There are four exams plus a cumulative final, but if you did the first four exams and are happy with your grade, the final is not required. There's a project at the end but it was not bad. The only thing is her exams can be tricky but she does give you a study guide.

This is my second Class with Dr. Miller after also taking Psyc 3205 with her. I don't have much to say. She is a pretty good professor, but the classes can be quite difficult, so you need to study hard. I definitely recommend her.

Dr. Miller is a pretty good professor. She has a lot of work on MacMillan that at the end of the day doesn't count toward much of your grade but is required.  If you work hard, you can definitely pull off an A, but you need to study well as there is a LOT of information. I plan on taking her again in the Spring for Psyc4460.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: She's an okay teacher. I felt she gave out a lot of busy work, each week we had between 7-10 little homework assignments on top of a quiz, or discussion post. Course work was short and interactive which made it a little better, however it could have been better focused with less filler assignments.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: It's hard to retain information from all of the material. Each week you have a chapter of work due. Expect a lot of reading. Hate the fact that she makes study guide available right when she opens the test.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: I took Professor Miller's course for PSYC 4460 this semester. We used MindTap (which helps learn the material and great for study), lectures, reading, and weekly discussion boards. 1 lowest test grade is dropped. If you are interested in abnormal psych, this course just goes even more in-depth, and I would highly recommend!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Miller is a great professor. She is willing to help you if you need it. This class revolves around a different online platform so you must keep up with that as well. Very easy class but comes with a ton of busy work. Her tests are with lockdown browser and webcam. Requires a ton of reading and activities through the platform.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Class was average but an easy A. There are so many assignments to complete within a week but it can be completed in a couple of hours. If class is online, test are lockdown browser and webcam.

There is so so much homework for being an online psychology class. There are I think 4 tests and then a cumulative final. Most things due on Sunday except for when she assigns discussion questions which are due on Thursday. Expect to spend a lot of ur time on this class unless you dont care to actually learn the material

she does not post her material on time. Tues. night rolls around and this weeks module hasn't been posted so I emailed her.. she forgot to post.. No extension either. We are now in Tues of the next week and this module isn't posted.. assignments are due Sunday. Stated in syllabus we have 1 w to finish. but we aren't given credit 4 her mistake
